intro: Salacia grandiflora, commonly known as the large-flowered salacia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Celastraceae and is characterized by its striking, showy yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a glossy surface, while its fruits are fleshy berries that contain several seeds.
